attributes.action: hold honourary parades for troops returning from overseas dutys (i.e. iraq and afghanistan)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
as a 16 year old boy, who believes in what the armed forces do, and gives them the upmost respect they deserve. i belive we should honour our troops. not through once a year awards cereomonies. but every time a squadron, troop or individual soldier returns from overseas duties, there should be an honours ceremony, where we as a british public should show our gratitude and show our respect to the hard work and unbelievable torment they go through. i am speaking from experience. my father SGT. Michael James Thompson was killed whilst in cyprus. the proffesionlism of the army really shon through in providing support. and as a great british public it is our responsibility to honour the service men and women who put there lives to fight for our defence and our freedom. i propose we show our respect to each member of the services returning to great britian. thank you for your support
Lewis Michael Thomspon
